Node.definition: = direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.gloss: to cut oneself|to gash oneself|to lacerate oneself
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans inflict wounds on their body with a knife, ► as a sign of mourning, or in order to reinforce one's prayer
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to happen ◄ as if it were an object placed in a certain position

= a hairless patch on the head of an animal or human being in a location where hair normally grows; ≈ this can be a natural phenomenon, as on the head of a vulture, but it can also be created by shaving the head as a sign of mourning
= the area separating two or mores locations
literally: between the eyes
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
literally: holy; hence: = state in which people have separated themselves from others ► in order to live their life in conformity to God's commandments
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= people, animals, and inanimate objects that are considered utterly wrong and detestable, because of their condition, their behavior, or because of certain customs
often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to humans (אָדָם) birds (עֹוף) reptiles (רֶמֶשׂ) insects (שֶׁרֶץ) and fish (דָּג)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= male or female herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns
= young of a sheep (שֶׂה) either male or female; ► clean animal, and allowed for food; also used for sacrifice
= male or female herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns

= a fairly small, female domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and relatively short hair, and usually found in one single flock (צֹאן) with sheep; ► raised for its milk, meat, and skin; a clean animal and therefore to be eaten

= wild animal, standing about a meter high, that ruminates, and of which the male grows antlers, which are dropped every year; has a reddish fur with white spots during summer; during winter the white spots disappear and the coat becomes darker; ◄ belongs to family of cervidae; ► clean animal and can therefore be eaten; ≈ associated with strength, speed, and agility; the male is also associated with sexual prowess

= small to medium sized plain antelope, inhabiting savannah plains and semideserts, reddish brown in color with almost white underparts, and small horns (with exception of female impala); long legged, graceful, and an expert jumper; lives in small herds; the female is sexually active at one year; high rate of reproduction; ◄ |iGazella dorcas|i* or |iGazella arabica|i*; ► clean and can therefore be eaten; ≈ associated with speed, grace, beauty, female sexuality, male virility, and fertility

= a large antelope that is about 1.5 meters (5 feet) high at the shoulder, with a long face with a large lump on the head from which short thick horns sprout; it is reddish brown in color; lives on plains and grazes in herds; it can run fast; ► a clean animal that people were allowed to eat

= fairly large wild goat, with adults being about ninety centimeters high at the shoulder; for most of the year its color is grayish but it turns browner in winter; males have thick long horns over 130 centimeters in length which curve backwards in a semicircle; the horns of the females are much slimmer and shorter, reaching a length of only about 40 centimeters; only the last few centimeters of the horns are smooth, the rest being ringed with ridges; these animals live in small herds in the mountains and prefer cliffs and crags, where they live off the bushes that grow on the ledges; ► clean animal, that may be eaten
= deerlike ruminant mammal of the Kobus family, of which the male grows two horns; feeds on plants; ◄ |iAddax nasomaculatus, Kobus|i*; ► clean animal which may be eaten

= medium sized antelope, about the size of a donkey, with long slender horns that are usually over a meter long; these horns are almost straight and slope back from the animal’s head at about thirty degrees from the perpendicular; the adults are a light fawn color with dark brown markings on the face and on the lower part of both front and back legs; the belly is white; ◄ Oryx leucoryx; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten
exact meaning unknown; probably: = wild sheep, wild goat or deer; ► clean and can therefore be eaten
often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to humans (אָדָם) birds (עֹוף) reptiles (רֶמֶשׂ) insects (שֶׁרֶץ) and fish (דָּג)
= state in which a countable entity is two in number
literally: to bring up the cud; hence: = causative action by which a ruminant animal brings up partly digested food from the stomach in order to chew it more
= the portion of food that is brought up into the mouth by ruminating animals from their first stomach to be chewed a second time
often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to humans (אָדָם) birds (עֹוף) reptiles (רֶמֶשׂ) insects (שֶׁרֶץ) and fish (דָּג)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
literally: to bring up the cud; hence: = causative action by which a ruminant animal brings up partly digested food from the stomach in order to chew it more
= the portion of food that is brought up into the mouth by ruminating animals from their first stomach to be chewed a second time

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= large quadruped mammal, which may reach a height of 2 m. or more; dromedaries are bigger and a uniform light fawn color; bactrians are darker; they are suited to life in desert areas, store excess food in their humps, can go without water for long periods, and can make long journeys through dry areas; ◄ Camelus dromedarius and Camelus bactrianus; ► they are used for riding and for carrying heavy loads and pulling carts; their hair is woven into cloth used for making tents or outer robes; their milk is used as food and drink; ≈ they are a symbol of wealth and commerce, but unclean and not to be eaten

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= relatively small, light brown animal about half a meter (20 inches) long, with long ears and a short fluffy tail; it has long hind legs and is a good jumper; it hides during the day and comes out to feed on vegetation at night; ► unclean animal and therefore not to be eaten

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= Syrian Rock Hyrax; animal with small round ears, no visible tail, and short legs, lives on leaves and herbs; two of their front teeth develop into small tusks; can run up almost vertical rock faces and climb trees with ease; ◄ procavia capensis syriaca; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with small size and wisdom
literally: to bring up the cud; hence: = causative action by which a ruminant animal brings up partly digested food from the stomach in order to chew it more
= the portion of food that is brought up into the mouth by ruminating animals from their first stomach to be chewed a second time
= state in which humans, animals, or objects are regarded by the law as having been contaminated, ► as a result of which they cannot participate in social and religious activities

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= hairy mammal with hoofs, brown or gray in color; non ruminant and omnivorous; ◄ |iSus scropus|i*, wild or domesticated land animal; ► unclean animal and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ regarded as an ugly, filthy, and destructive animal and often associated with pagan rituals
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= the portion of food that is brought up into the mouth by ruminating animals from their first stomach to be chewed a second time
= state in which humans, animals, or objects are regarded by the law as having been contaminated, ► as a result of which they cannot participate in social and religious activities
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= the dead body of humans or animals
= process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, either or not deliberately

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= appendage on the body of a fish or other aquatic animal, ► used for propelling, steering, and balancing
= small overlapping plates covering the body of a fish
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= appendage on the body of a fish or other aquatic animal, ► used for propelling, steering, and balancing
= small overlapping plates covering the body of a fish
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= state in which humans, animals, or objects are regarded by the law as having been contaminated, ► as a result of which they cannot participate in social and religious activities
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= generic term for a small bird; ► usually clean and can therefore be eaten
= state in which people, animals, or objects are considered free from contamination, ► as a result of which the people can interact socially with others and the objects can be put to normal use
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of large birds of prey with keen eyesight; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ associated with large size and great strength, ability to fly great distances at high speed; symbol of protection, metaphor for God, but also symbol for death in battle

exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of eagles and vultures of a slightly smaller size than the נֶשֶׁר (נֶשֶׁר) including: the Gypaëtus barbatus (Bearded vulture or Lammergeier), the Circaetus gallicus (alternatively Circaetus pectoralus: the Black breasted Snake Eagle, the Short toed Eagle, the Black chested Harrier Eagle), and the Hieraeetus pennatus (Booted Eagle), as well as one or two others
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = relatively small type of vulture; ◄ Aegypius monachus; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

= bird of prey, dark brown with a greyish head and a long V shaped tail, flies relatively low and slowly; feeds on insects, frogs, lizards, and food scraps from human dwellings, and scavenge dead fish or other dead animals; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= bird of prey of a relatively small size, that can fly fast, but also hover; lives on rats, mice, and other birds; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

exact meaning unknown, possibly: = dark brown bird with a grayish head and a long triangular tail that looks V shaped as it maneuvers the two outer feathers; ◄ Milvus migrans; ► it feeds on insects, frogs, lizards, and food scraps from human dwellings, and scavenges dead fish and shellfish along the beaches of oceans, lakes, and rivers; they also pick off small bits of meat from animal carcasses; unclean and therefore not to be eaten
= a group of items, such as plants or animals, sharing similar characteristics

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a large black bird with a thick strong beak, and fairly short legs; it is highly intelligent and seems to enjoy flying; it eats almost anything, including grain, fruit, insects, lizards, frogs, eggs, nestlings, and the meat of dead animals; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ its black color is regarded as beautiful
= a group of items, such as plants or animals, sharing similar characteristics

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
see יַעְַנָה (יַעֲנָה)

exact meaning unknown; probably: = a type of owl, large, standing over 75 centimeters (30 inches) tall; it has a pale fawn color, is spotted, has ear tufts, and is best known by its loud, deep hooting at night; it roosts by day in deep shade in acacia trees, caves, tombs, and ruined buildings; it feeds on small mammals, including hares, baby gazelles, lambs, rats and mice, and large roosting birds, especially wild and domestic ducks; ◄ Bubo bubo; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

exact meaning unknown; possibly: = type of owl, medium sized and with a brown color, but with a paler face and ear tufts that are not very prominent; it makes a strange sound like an animal or a person snoring; it lives in grassland and semi desert regions; ◄ Asio flammeus; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten|exact meaning unknown; possibly: = speckled brown bird that is about 15 centimeters (6 inches) long, with a short beak that can open very wide; it flies by night and feeds on flying insects; during the day they roost on the ground or on thick branches; their presence in an area is known from their calls at night; ◄ Caprimulgus nubicus or Caprimulgus europaeus; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= seabird, living on the coasts of large bodies of water; white with gray or black back and upper wing surfaces; it has long flexible wings; it feeds on fish or plankton, usually settling on the water to feed; some dive into the water for their food, and many are also shoreline scavengers, eating dead fish, crabs, and shellfish; Larus ridibundus, Larus argentatus, ◄ Sterna hirundo, Sterna albifrons; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= bird of prey of a relatively small size, that can fly fast, but also hover; lives on rats, mice, and other birds; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten
= a group of items, such as plants or animals, sharing similar characteristics

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

exact meaning unknown; probably: = a small type of owl, of about 25 centimeters (10 inches) in length, with a short tail and without ear tufts, which feeds at night mainly on insects and nestlings; it nests in holes in banks or termite hills; ◄ Athene noctua; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

exact meaning unknown; possibly: type of owl with a mottled gray brown color; its eyes are outlined with pale circles, so that it looks as though it is wearing spectacles; it prefers wooded areas or orchards and roosts close to the trunk of a tree; ◄ Strix aluco; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

exact meaning unknown; probably: = type of owl with a very pale color, light fawn or gray on the wings and back, and almost white on the chest and under the wings; it has small eyes, a large head for its size, and a very striking heart shaped white facial disk outlined in brown; it often roosts in barns, deserted houses, caves, and tombs; it lives mainly on rats, mice, and other small nocturnal creatures; ◄ Tyto alba; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten
exact meaning unsure: = relatively small black bird; ► unclean; ≈ associated with loneliness, devastation, destruction, and possibly death

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= relatively small type of vulture with a long, untidy, light orange brown feathers on its neck and head, a bare yellow face, and a yellow beak that is longer and less hooked than most vultures; the rest of the body and wings are white with black wing tips; it feeds on the scraps of carrion dropped by larger vultures, since its beak is not strong enough to tear skin and meat easily; usually scavenges scraps on beaches or rubbish dumps and eats the eggs of ground nesting waterside birds such as plovers, sandpipers, curlews, and others, which it breaks by knocking them with a large stone; ◄ Neophron percnopterus; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= an eagle like bird that feeds on fish. It has a white head, chest, and belly, with a dark brown back and wings. It has a dark stripe from the edge of the beak through the eye to the back of the neck and a faint stripe on its chest; ◄ Pandion haliaetus; it is found on seacoasts and near lakes and large rivers; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

= large bird with long legs and a long neck; the white stork has a white body and black wings, whereas the black stork is a glossy brownish black color with a white belly; both varieties have a red beak and legs; both types spend most of the time on the ground or in shallow water searching for food; the white stork eats mainly locusts, grasshoppers, and other insects, as well as frogs, lizards, and the chicks of ground nesting birds, whereas the black stork prefers fish and frogs but also eats the same things as the white stork; ◄ |iCiconia ciconia|i* or |iCiconia nigra|i*; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

= fairly large bird with a long neck, long beak, and long legs; they stand or walk slowly in shallow water in rivers, dams, ponds, or lakes looking into the water for small fish, which they catch by suddenly darting their heads into the water; they fly with slow wing beats; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten
= a group of items, such as plants or animals, sharing similar characteristics

= bird about the size of a large dove, with a ginger colored head and body, and with wings and a tail that have black and white stripes; it has a long slender beak that curves slightly, and a long crest on its head, which it can erect into a fan shape; it has rather floppy wings and rises and falls as it flies; it spends a lot of time walking around on the ground looking for food; it eats insects and their larvae, termites, worms, small frogs, and beetles;◄ |iUpupa epops|i*; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten

= mammal with a fur skin, and slender elongated forelegs and fingers that support a flap of skin joining its fingers to its toes, which functions as a wing and allows it to fly; they fly around at night and hang upside down from trees or overhanging rocks during the day; also found in caves, tombs, unoccupied houses, and old ruins; ◄ classified as a bird by ancient Israelites because of its ability to fly; ► unclean; ≈ associated with death, desolation, destruction, and witchcraft
= state in which humans, animals, or objects are regarded by the law as having been contaminated, ► as a result of which they cannot participate in social and religious activities
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= state in which people, animals, or objects are considered free from contamination, ► as a result of which the people can interact socially with others and the objects can be put to normal use
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= the dead body of humans or animals

= state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker classes within the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the widows, the fatherless, and other people who are poor
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option
= causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money
= person who comes from a foreign country and therefore has a different status from those who are native born
literally: holy; hence: = state in which people have separated themselves from others ► in order to live their life in conformity to God's commandments
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= causative process by which humans prepare food for consumption by immersing it in boiling water for a prolonged period
= the male young of a goat (עֵז)

= white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food
literally: to come out; = process by which land or a living organism produces crops, branches, horns, or fruits

= a piece of land outside of inhabited areas, which is the property of individuals, generally used for cultivating food trees, grain, and vegetables; can be bought and sold; property which can be transferred from one person to another
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= seeds of cultivated cereal; ► used as food

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of newly harvested grapes and possibly still at the beginning of the fermentation process; ► used as beverage and for sacrifice; ≈ represents the entire range of agricultural products in Israel, together with grain and oil; associated with joy and well being, and only once with drunkenness and foolishness
= high quality oil (שֶׁמֶן) ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food and in various religious rituals
= first offspring of any female; ► in the case of humans, the main heir of estate and blessing

= large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= process by which humans or animals acquire knowledge or skill from an identified or unidentified source, ► which usually results in a specific behavior or skill

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
literally: all the days; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
literally: road; hence: = the space between two places

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
literally: to cause to hold, carry; hence: = causative action by which humans take hold of objects and bring them to another location
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
literally: to put (one's) name (somewhere); hence: = causative action by which deities link their name to a certain location by declaring it their dwelling place
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= causative action by which humans tie together small objects in a bag or piece of cloth ► for ease of carrying
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

Node.gloss: to hold, carry, have (in one's luggage)
Node.definition: literally: in (one's) hand; hence: = state of carrying an object physically in one's hand or as part of one's luggage
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= state in which humans sense a physical craving for food or alcoholic drinks; this desire is associated with one's נֶפֶשׁ (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex

= alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of dates through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= member of the Levite clan, responsible for temple duties
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= one part of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided into several portions
= state in which a countable entity is three in number

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= member of the Levite clan, responsible for temple duties

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= one part of an object (or range of objects) that has been divided into several portions

= state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker classes within the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the widows, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

= person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

= woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
